channel.name: With the addition of OffchainState to o1js, what are the important details we should be aware of?

messages.content:
Hey team, wanted to ask the limitations we have on the OffchainState 
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#131---2024-06-11
Like how long does it persist, is it overwritten with each update and any other important details? Thank you :)
Changed the channel name: With the addition of OffchainState to o1js, what are the important details we should be aware of?
I have gone through https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1630 for the intro, but still would like to ask about any possible things that are not recommended in production

> Like how long does it persist
offchain state is always recreated from actions fetched from an archive node. so the answer is: as long as there is an archive node.

> is it overwritten with each update
I think this is actually described in detail in our docs, let me know if you have more questions about it after reading this: https://docs.minaprotocol.com/zkapps/writing-a-zkapp/feature-overview/offchain-storage

I wouldn't recommend using it in production right now mainly for two reasons:
* it's not stable: we still might change the API and implementation, which means a zkapp deployed now that uses offchain state might not be compatible with a future o1js version.
* it relies on `Experimental.IndexedMerkleMap` as the merkle tree implementation, which hasn't been reviewed by a cryptographer yet (except me who implemented it)

Regarding the PR description you read @br0wnD3v, note that we did implement the safe `update()` metod in a later PR, but we didn't add commutative actions yet. So offchain state is not really usable for global shared state that is written concurrently
It should be well-suited to storing a large amount of per-user state though
thanks for the heads-up @gregor, answers the questions I had 👍 Will continue thread if I stumble upon more
so something like user balances I guess?

yeah definitely. or also
* scores in a game
* entries representing registered users in some voting/identity scheme
* NFTs
* ...

what it doesn't support properly atm is _aggregate_ state like
* max score of all players
* total supply = sum of all balances
* ...
ah I see, but we can have a mix of the global state on the contract itself and then the storage right?
global state to store the sum and individual holdings at storage
onchain state has the same caveats though for aggregate state - it's not concurrency-friendly
oh and one more important caveat to be aware of: you can't use `OffchainState` together with your own custom `Reducer`
Because offchain state already uses actions and defines its own action type
I see

I copy pasted it from the github example but there's something wrong on my end?? 
I am on o1js 1.4.0
According to the errors it rather seems they originate from the types files of the OffchainState

Usually these sorts of type errors are related to an old typescript version. Try updating your node_modules to include the [same version as o1js](https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/647c7e5e55f927737ab854bc92eed9f55bc46a61/package.json#L99C5-L99C23) and see if that helps

messages.content: Also @br0wnD3v we changed how the on chain state is declared, can you update that part to the current example?
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/647c7e5e55f927737ab854bc92eed9f55bc46a61/src/lib/mina/actions/offchain-contract.unit-test.ts#L29

messages.content: thank you @gregor and @o1martin, ill look into what you guys suggested, thanks 🤝
